https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap12.html

12.5 Approach
Phase E is the initial step on the creation of the *Implementation and Migration Plan* which is completed in Phase F. It provides the basis of a well-considered Implementation and Migration Plan that is integrated into the enterprise's portfolio in Phase F.
The following four concepts are key to transitioning from developing to delivering a Target Architecture:

Architecture Roadmap.
Work Packages.
Transition Architectures.
Implementation and Migration Plan.

The Implementation and Migration Plan provides a schedule of the projects that will realize the Target Architecture.

The objectives of Phase E are to:
■ Generate the initial complete version of the Architecture Roadmap, based upon the gap
analysis and candidate Architecture Roadmap components from Phases B, C, and D
■ Determine whether an incremental approach is required, and if so identify Transition
Architectures that will deliver continuous business value
■ Define the overall solution building blocks to finalize the Target Architecture based on the
Architecture Building Blocks (ABBs)

choices.D: To manage requirements throughout the ADM
choices.A: To define the initial implementation plans
choices.B: To define the scope, identifying stakeholders and obtaining approvals
choices.E: To perform architectural oversight for the implementation

questions.question_text: Which one of the following best describes the purpose of ADM Phase E?

Selected Answer: B
Not part of 9.2 but correct answer: B

questions.question_text: Which one of the following categories from the Document Categorization model consists of the normative parts of TOGAF which are considered central to its usage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer: C
33.2.2: A building block’s boundary and speciﬁcation should be loosely coupled to its implementation

Answer is C.

33.2.2: A building block’s boundary and speciﬁcation should be loosely coupled to its implementation

A building block’s boundary and specification should be loosely coupled to its implementation;
i.e., it should be possible to realize a building block in several different ways without impacting
the boundary or specification of the building block. The way in which assets and capabilities are
assembled into building blocks will vary widely between individual architectures

questions.question_text: Which one of the following statements about TOGAF Building Blocks is true?

choices.B: Solutions Building Blocks are selected in Phases A, B, C and D
choices.A: Building blocks at a functional level are known as Solutions Building Blocks
choices.D: The gap analysis technique should be used to identify building blocks for re-use
choices.C: The specification of a building block should be loosely coupled to its implementation
